lenders.name: Don
lenders.loan_because: I want to serve and free people.
lenders.occupational_info: I equip leaders to compassionately  serve others.

lenders.name: Jeff Cooney
lenders.loan_because: I want to do some good out there.

lenders.name: The Kellys
lenders.loan_because: it feels good to make a difference - even a small one.   We feel lucky to be able to contribute to the success of others, across the globe.

lenders.name: Alexander
lenders.loan_because: My first experience with investing was through mutual funds promising steady growth -- the traditional definition of financial responsibility. Not only did these funds not deliver, but their portfolio was full of corporations that were building a world that I didn't want to live in. Now I'm looking forward to building real wealth by supporting responsible individuals directly.
lenders.occupational_info: I work for Auburn University's Office of Sustainability where we focus on how our university can best adapt itself to inspire those in our region and the world at large to live responsible and productive lives.

lenders.name: Nicky
lenders.loan_because: To assist fellow entrepreneurs who have even tougher obstacles then we face here in NZ
lenders.occupational_info: Co-Director of Seekom which provides online  booking technology to tourism operators (accommodation, rental vehicles, etc) worldwide

lenders.name: SusanTerplevichMemorial
lenders.loan_because: An amazing teacher, Dr. T has helped students  for the past 42 years make the most of their potential, accomplish their goals, and live their lives to the fullest.  Through Kiva, we want to continue to extend Sue's reach to all corners of the world.
lenders.occupational_info:
Sue has taught students of all ages who have had trouble learning in a traditional classroom and have needed special, individualized instruction.  She received the New Jersey Governor's Teacher Recognition Award for Excellence in Teaching, and has served as  department coordinator in our high school.  She earned her Ph.D. (that's why we call her Dr. T!), and has been a mentor and inspiration for countless other teachers.

She is much loved, and very deeply missed.

lenders.name: Christopher
lenders.loan_because: Access to capital is necessary for any entrepreneurial endeavor to succeed . . . and I love entrepreneurs!

lenders.name: Laurel Leone
lenders.loan_because: I have been a small business owner for over 20 years, and I love the idea of supporting other working women to become more financially independent and to improve their lives through work, service and family.
lenders.occupational_info: We help our clients get found by those who are looking for the products and services they offer

lenders.name: Brian
lenders.loan_because: I like to ...... I can ...... and I get great pleasure from helping those less fortunate than myself who have a dream to fulfill.   What better way than through Kiva?
lenders.occupational_info: I am a retired security officer and crew a steam tourist train in my home town in my spare time.

lenders.name: Natalie
lenders.loan_because: we're all in this together!

lenders.loan_because: I want to make a difference. My focus for lending is on women entrepreneurs seeking funding for their business that has some interest in fiber (clothing, crafts, weaving etc.).
lenders.occupational_info: I am a conceptual artist with a strong focus on textiles.

lenders.loan_because: God has blessed me with the privilege to do so, and I want to encourage others to live a meaningful life.

lenders.name: Dale and Tsumugi

lenders.name: Pat and Joe
lenders.loan_because: We are able to loan, and we are so lucky to be able to do so-- it is just chance that we were born into middle class families in the United States
lenders.occupational_info: I, Pat, study seabirds' breeding biology and foraging ecology & shorebirds' migration and how these have changed, and I use this information as an indicator of the health of the planet.   I see how these birds are affected by what we as humans have done re: pollution, overfishing, etc., and give answers of how we are able to correct our errors and help the planet.

lenders.loan_because: my family and I  wish to use the money we would have spent on Christmas gifts for each other to help those less fortunate than ourselves.
lenders.occupational_info: I work caring for severely disabled adults. My sons are students and a furniture maker. We also have a house builder and office worker in the family mix.

lenders.occupational_info: I manufacture biological indicators -- small tests that are used to make sure sterilization equipment (in hospitals, research and teaching laboratories, tattoo parlors, etc.) is working.

Laurie manages projects, mostly in the IT industry.

lenders.occupational_info: I'm a family medicine resident in San Jose, with a focus on caring for the medically underserved.

lenders.loan_because: It makes sense to give to others when you have virtually everything you need. For me it's a little gesture, for others it's a contribution to build up a better life. This is globalization as it should be!
lenders.occupational_info: I am doing research on and analyzing the automotive industry with regard to market conditions, supplier competition etc.

lenders.loan_because:
I can.

lenders.name: Taras
lenders.loan_because: I need to finish bussines project! It's internet tour portal where people can buy tours, excursions, book hotels on-line by credit card! It's starts from Ukraine and we will expand our project on other countries!
lenders.occupational_info: I'm working in tour company (own with my friend). I'm calculte, create  tours make treaties,  creating tour portal with my friend!

lenders.name: Ashley
lenders.loan_because: I am lucky to have what I do and I want to share with others

lenders.name: Philipp
lenders.loan_because: I think it is the best way to help people directly.

lenders.name: familie Smilde
lenders.loan_because:
we decided, as a family, we could do more with our birthday-present-money, then just buy presents :-)
So our Kiva-initiative was born. We started in 2009 with 10 dollars each to see if this could work for us.....

lenders.name: Polina
lenders.loan_because:
I like that in Kiva money circulates and helps many people over and over again. I have committed to "1 loan a day" plan and have stuck with it since 1/1/10 hoping one day to turn this into a life-changing self-sustaining perpetually-lending money circulation machine.

19/10/11 update: It just hit me that I am lending at a rate of 2+loans per day (70+/month). Seems I need to raise the plank and turn it into 3 loans/day by the start of 2012. I will also hit 1000 loans mark right about that time too so it will be a major milestone. Also with now a little of $6k in the account, I made $20k worth of loans. If anyone else needs convincing of the magic of Kiva, I don't know what else to say.

1/1/11 update: This has turned into a life-changing self-sustaining perpetually-lending money circulation machine much sooner than I thought! As of the start of this year I do not need to put in any more money into kiva and with the balance of only $5600 I relend my repayments at a rate of just over 1 loan a day. Yeepeee!!

Next goal for the end of 2011 (taking advantage of the "estimated repayment" stats page) to have enough money in kiva so that estimated repayments over the next 3 months total my minimum living expenses (aka "rainy day fund"). So instead of the fat banks getting even fatter off my savings Kiva entrepreneurs can put food on their family's tables. Yeehaa!
lenders.occupational_info: work? what work?.. I run a web design company for a couple of hours a day and the rest of the time I cook, read, garden, hang out and do nothing - life is paradise!

lenders.name: Shinsuke
lenders.loan_because:
I think this "KIVA" model is quite excellent.
Even each action is small, that will finally make great changes.

lenders.occupational_info: I help raise money for a non-profit (NGO) that saves animals and their habitats through conservation leadership and engaging experiences inspiring people to learn, care and act.

lenders.name: Stephen
lenders.loan_because:
The Bible says in Proverbs 21:13 (NIV)  that..."If a man shuts his ears to the cry of the poor, he too will cry out and not be answered."

I was born in Ghana and migrated to Canada as a young adult. My un-educated single-parent mother had no opportunity to borrow from the bank to start a trade. It is often difficult to raise capital to commence any form of trade in a poor or developing country if you do not have a significant collateral.

Today, I consider myself blessed and I would like to make an impact on other people's lives by helping out with the little that I can.
lenders.occupational_info: I am an Information Technology professional - or a computer programmer. Presently, I manage a team of computer professionals who develop websites on the internet.
